alert.note: Alert for Latimer; Le Flore; McIntosh; Okfuskee; Okmulgee; Pittsburg; Pushmataha (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 24 at 4:34AM CDT until September 24 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central, northeast, and southeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in east central Oklahoma, Okfuskee. In northeast Oklahoma, Okmulgee. In southeast Oklahoma, Haskell, Latimer, Le Flore, McIntosh, Pittsburg and Pushmataha. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 432 AM CDT, Although the heavy rainfall has ended, between 3 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. Excessive runoff and flooding is expected to continue through mid morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mcalester... Okemah... Wilburton... Eufaula... Clayton... Henryetta... Hartshorne... Krebs... Boley... Talihina... Quinton... Weleetka... Dewar... Red Oak... Crowder... Fanshawe... Alderson... Kinta... Canadian... Indianola... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Latimer; Le Flore; McIntosh; Okfuskee; Okmulgee; Pittsburg; Pushmataha
